column2: Cloudy- calm lake- algae around shoreline.
Cloudy- overcast sky- algae floating in bays and along the shoreline.
Lots of rain- lake level high 4-5"- cloudy.
More rain this week- @ 1 inch of rain- slightly cloudy.
More rain this past week- sunny sky.
Cloudy with choppy water and weed growth on top in large areas.
Clear day (sunny) and weed growth near shoreline and also away from shore.
Clear- sunny- and slight choppy water.
Slightly cloudy- choppy- and more weed growth this year.
Clear sky- calm- and weed growth diminished.
This was the clearest the lake has been in the last 5 years.
This is the cleanest the lake has been in the last 5 years.
This is the cleanest the lake has been in the last 5 years.  More weed growth did not hamper swimming.
This was the cleanest the lake has been in the last 5 years.  More weed growth did not hamper swimming.
More weed growth did not hamper swimming.  This was the cleanest the lake has been in the last 5 years.
More weed growth did not hamper swimming.
This was the cleanest the lake has been in the last 5 years.
Partially cloudy and the water looked good.
Sunny with slight clouds and the water looked good.
Sunny with partial clouds and water still fairly good.
Sunny day and the lake still looked good.
Sunny and calm.  The lake looks great.
Sunny- calm water- and it rained in the morning.
Hazy- hot and muggy- and the water is like pea soup.
Bright and sunny.  The water is clearer.
Sunny and the water improved in clarity.

column1: clear sunny day - sent same information to Kent State

column2: slightly cloudy water but still good
hot weather caused cloudy lake conditions
cooler weather and some rain cleared the lake beautifully
Bright sunny day - did not prevent swimming and fishing.
Bright partial clouds  - did not prevent swimming and fishing.
Bright sunny day - did not prevent swimming and fishing.
Partial clouds but clear and sunny - except for cloudy appearance- lake looked good.
Bright sunny day.  Except for cloudy water appearance lake looked good.
Bright sky- water looks very good
Bright sunny- water slightly turbid- Report to Dip-In to Kent State
Bright sunny- water turbid- good fishing and swimming
Bright sunny- water turbid- still ok for swimming and fishing
Weather: clear- breezy.  It had rained in the morning
Cloudy- 81 degrees F- Water level approx 1 ft low.
Sunny and 77 degrees.  Lake level remains approx 1 foot low.   Planktonic algae dominates.
85 deg F- Sunny.  Moderate amounts of filamentous algae present
Air temp: 78 deg F.  Partly cloudy.
Sunny- 81 degrees F.  Planktonic algae- responsible for low SD readings in 2015- replaced by Chara.  Chara never seen in this lake before now.

column1: Fish kill affecting  more than 150 fish all species observed 5/28/2016.  Examination shows columnaris.

column2: Outside air temp 79 deg F.  Sunny and calm.  There was 5 inches of rainfall in the previous week.  Algae has transitioned from Chara observed in June to Planktonic in July.
Clear skies- temperature 72 deg-F- accompanied by Greg Kessler.
